intro: Muraltia decandollei, commonly known as the pink mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas. Muraltia decandollei is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
